sentences.en: His stable services were merely a sinecure, and consisted simply in a daily care and inspection.
sentences.cn: 他在马厩里的工作是个轻闲差使, 每天只要去照料照料巡视一番.

sentences.en: She found him an exalted sinecure as a Fellow of the Library of Congress.
sentences.cn: 她给他找了一个级别很高的闲职：国会图书馆研究员。

sentences.en: This is a [ not a, no ] sinecure.
sentences.cn: 这哪里是 [ 不是 ] 闲差事((很忙)).

sentences.en: This is hardly a [ not a, no ] sinecure.
sentences.cn: 这哪里是 [ 不是 ] 闲差事((很忙)).

trans.tran_cn: 工作清闲但报酬优厚的职位，挂名的好差事
trans.tran_en: a job which you get paid for even though you do not have to do very much work
